title: *.moi.gov.af
content:
passport.moi.gov.af has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.
creator: aimalyagana394

title: Accessing Google in Firefox Browser
content: Hi, I've been involved in IT for many years but have stuck an issue I'm unable to resolve. As a search engine I like to use www.google.com.au which works fine until I log into my Google account. Once I'm logged in to my account the home page reverts to www.google.com and I'm unable to add the .au. I've confirmed it happening on three different machines over the past couple of days. If I use Edge, Chrome or Brave, the problem does not arise, so I must conclude there is an issue somewhere within Firefox. Any help would be greatly appreciated Many Thanks Phil

title: Why did multiple tabs just randomly disappear from my main window?
content:
I ran into a glitch in another program, and as part of trying to fix it I rebooted my computer. On doing so, I find that the VAST majority of the tabs I had open in my main browsing window have disappeared - some of them out of tab groups I'd created to avoid losing the tabs in question. Neither tab history nor browser history show the missing tabs.

What gives?! Is there any way to restore the window as I had it, say, yesterday?
creator: hobbitguy1420

title: Firefox intermittently disables keyboard while scrolling, requires reboot
content:
When browsing with Firefox, scrolling with the up/down arrow keys intermittently causes the keyboard to be disabled. Trackpad and touchscreen still function, but keyboard becomes completely disabled, requiring a reboot.

I've had this problem for over a year and through several versions. It also happens when running in safe mode, so that should eliminate any plugins.

This ONLY happens while browsing with Firefox browser. I cannot deliberately reproduce this, but it happens frequently - up to several times a day. It seems to be tied to scrolling with the down and up keys. This only happens in Firefox, not in any other apps or browsers.

Can anyone help me isolate the problem and find a fix? I am a retired programmer, so I should be able to get to the bottom of this with some help. I suspect that my env may be so unique that nobody can

Environment: FIREFOX 125.0.2 64 bit through 138.0.1

Windows 11 Edition Windows 11 Pro Version 23H2 Installed on ‎2/‎13/‎2024 OS build 22631.3447 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.22688.1000.0

Keyboard drivers: HID Keyboard Device 

  ETD.sys            15.56.2.26           ELAN Microelectronics Corp.    kbdclass.sys    10.0.22621.1 (Winbuild.160101.0800)       Microsoft   kbdhid.sys        10.0.22621.1 (Winbuild.160101.0800)       Microsoft

Standard PS/2 Keyboard 

  ETD.sys            15.56.2.26           ELAN Microelectronics Corp.    i8042prt.sys    10.0.22621.1 (Winbuild.160101.0800)       Microsoft   kbdclass.sys    10.0.22621.1 (Winbuild.160101.0800)       Microsoft
